characters: BXT, GEORGE'S SECOND APT BLDG-GEORGE MOVES TOWARD CAMERA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romantic night - and now moving into camera the couple to prove it. LISA, a really pretty 27 year old woman who has made every sacrifice of mind, body and spirit in order no feel the way she does at this moment: self-conscious and threatened by a vague set of ordinary emotions which, wor of all to her, serve no constructive purpose whatsoever. Still, here she is, after a lifetime unafraid of anything with fear poking secretly away at her while her date, Mat (a “hunk” who is frequently mistaken for a “catch”) is in background causing a small flurry of excitement signing a autograph. .He looks and sees her failing to make the tur his building. .

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: (calling out) Left! Lisa bobbles with distraction and then makes the turn. Sh quickly ensnared by her persistent troubling thoughts. ON Matty... As he looks at her and grins with impulse and a veteran’s sense of mischief based on deep appreciation of the night her swirling skirt and the promise of simple pleasures. H comes up behind her ear and responds to her yelp with the absolute truth.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: Night's so great. You look so good. Just need to grab you.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Huh. .Sorry I didn‘t.. But that quick he has lifted and swirled her. Then, maybe she was just getting into the ride, drops her.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: We're here.. He gestures with his head to a nearby apartment building, best apartment building in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks toward the front door - the doorman greets him b name..Lisa hesitates, ambivalent..not her usual decisive self.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Hey..Matty..I may have to go back on what I said about finally seeing your place tonight..there’s a lot on my mind right now and.. Matty, unaccustomed to even minor adversity, has a flash well, not depression..a flash of not feeling fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (Light. .half laughing. .honest) Well, no.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: (cowboy justice) No pressure here. It should feel right. His John Wayne moral center impresses Lisa. .but then he several steps back..

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: That’s nice. Thanks. Why are you moving away?

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: Give you room to think and decide. The doorman also backs off a few spaces. Lisa looks at th two men staring at her.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: Take your time. I get a kick out of watching you make up your mind. He means it. He is having a good time giving her space an enjoying the mystery. She moves forward toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: You have all the signs of a handful .

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: Hope so. She takes a swing at him, a solid fist and perfectly bala are to his stomach...she is surprised by her own action..

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry did I hurt you?

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: dust got me more interested. He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a truly expensive apartment -- we are now in the bedroom where there are a great many trophies in evidence besides our Lisa, who now lies next to her spanking new l having more than held up her end of the just concluded lengthy and athletic night of love making. She can’t, however, quite match his grin. Matty’s in a state of some wonder - celebrating the fact that hig expectations have exceeded.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: Amazing..Female jocks are amazing.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (a level look) Could you personalize it a Little? Matty cracks up..

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: (enthusiastically) Right, right, right. .I meant it as tribute to you, Lisa Jorgenson. Come on, it was amazing, huh? That was unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Fishing for a compliment?

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: (exuberant) i'm fishing for a celebration.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I have to get going. She scoops up her clothes and groans over how wrinkled he dress is ag she moves toward the bathroom. We move with h perhaps noting perfect long smooth muscles in her arms an legs.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: (o.c.) There’s a fresh toothbrush in the right hand drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands in front of the sink now and opens the right h drawer.

dialogues.speaker: DRAWER
dialogues.text: Two dozen unused toothbrushes lined up -- all in unbroken glass containers. She takes this in then breaks open the container and is brushing her teeth when there is a.. kno on the door..She opens it..

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: You don’t have to wear that dress home. He moves past her and opens a cabinet where there is a st of unopened women’s sweats.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: Medium? He hands her a package. She reacts with extreme distaste.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: The stack is a little --- repulsively unromantic.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: No it's not. It's classy. I’m being a good host here.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: It's like I‘m on an assembly line spitting out girls.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: That's just negative. Aren't we all on an assembly line - going through each other’s lives until one day we close down the factory, take home a product and use it monogamously for the rest of our lives? She starts putting on her dress.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Matty, my mistake. .forget about it.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: If I hid the rest and gave you one I'd be a great guy. .but because I am open with you... she moves past him heading for the front door.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: dust forget it!

dialogues.speaker: MATTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Too bad.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA MOVES AHEAD OF THEM
dialogues.text: INT. MATTY’S APT. - HALLWAY/BEDROOM 6 This is purposefully a traditional romantic vignette of h woman, with a backbone, about to express herself with forceful exit..it‘s why doors were made to slam. and then that quick she catches herself - holding the doo pre-slam wind-up then turns toward him, genuinely apologe

dialogues.speaker: . LISA
dialogues.text: Hey Matty...What am I doing? I know better.. “Don't judge anybody before you check yourself out. You're lucky when it's your fault because then you can correct the situation.” (working it out as if with a friend)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA (cont 'd) I'm nervous over something and a little worried so I ended up with , an attractive guy who you'd have to be an idiot to mistake for serious material..for anything but a fun friendship -- and rather than accept the evening as a chance to hide out from myself with some really amazing sex, I start to give him a hard time for just being who he is. I really apologize. Please, forgive me.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: You may be my “dream girl.” She grabs her panties and exits.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: You take care.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: What are you worried about, anyways?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (forcefully) Nothing! I can't believe I’m whining about it. Crap! As she turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa -- wrinkled dress -- stops —~ takes running shoes fr her purse and puts them on. .She then moves purposefully. walk arresting in its precision and power. ..passing people. ..she ig in a hurry..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa standing -- her face tight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Lisa moves down a lower middle class block to her apt.  10 11 12 WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she stops at the foot of the stairs to open a compartm and withdraw a weighted vest which she puts on..and then begins to hop up the stairs two at a time..It's a hell of stunt..as hard as it looks and this image, of athlete straining, while wearing a hopelessly wrinkled party dres strangely a very appropriate image for what awaits her. INT. LISA’S APT. - DAY. 11 Easily as many trophies as Matty (including two Olympic g medals)..inevitable rows of team pictures, she cares abou team. (Note: how they are displayed is a project for us.) Furniture is very basic..one of those L shaped rooms with bend of the “L” considered the bedroom -- pullout sofa. . walks directly to a desk on which sits her computer.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Lisa pauses over the keys. She sniffs the air, oxygen her long time elixir. She does not touch the keys; instead mo off and leaving the scene. We hear the shower start.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: As she sits again at the computer. Here's the thing about this moment. In the truest sense of the word we are witnessing an act of private bravery. Lisa's life, as she knows it and has lived it, is on the line. Yet, the signs small as she weighs her dicey options for survival.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: As Lisa hits the site of the “UNITED STATES NATIONAL SOFT ASSOCIATION.” She clicks on “NEW ROSTER OF PLAYERS” ..And reads: “THIS YEAR’S ROSTER IS DELAYED.”

dialogues.speaker: ON LISA
dialogues.text: She is struck by foreboding and simultaneously beats the feeling back. Her fingers take action..she clicks her way on-line ticketing and confirms “least expensive” trip to Phoenix. A cute tone confirms she has scored for a ticket

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 13 14 WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 8.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: It is off-seagon but there are college athletes and natio players working on some drills which look enormously hard do. When the players spot Lisa they stop immediately. .a subtle flurry of hero worship ensues. . She exchanges a d hug with one or two of her teammates. . INT, ATHLETIC DEPARTMENT - WOMEN’S WING - EDIT BAY - DAY This is the home of champions. Olympic memorabilia in evidence. NCAA Champion cups, etc. She is drawn to one crowded editing bin cubicle where coaches and a few athle tech support persons watch a television set in a darkened area. As she passes SALLY, an assistant coach (late 30's- early 40's -- clearly athletic looking) calls to her.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Hey..my fave. What are you doing here? I didn’t think I'd see you till the Jersey clinic. We’re just editing the promotional video. (to student editor) Show her part.. Lisa indicates she'd rather not..Sally gestures forcefull that she should see it.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Just for a minute. Before the student editor scrolls the images, Lisa is the sticking out her hand.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Lisa Jorgenson. The student is flattered and gives her name, Jane.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Good to meet you. Lisa retreats to the background. We alternate between THE MONITOR and Lisa, who is a little self-conscious being ey by others as she witnesses her own past glories.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Co-captain and second baseman Lisa Jorgenson - ended Australia’s rally..and secures the cup. .The United States wins its 7th world championship. We see a montage of Lisa’s steller play in this game endi with a backdoor slide, scoring the winning run, after whi she roars in competitive exultation at the opposing catch

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: (horribly fake chuckle) Captain Jorgenson is the mother hen of the celebration. VARIOUS SHOTS..Lisa making sure everyone is taken care of..she stops one of the players from taking off her shir ala Brandy Chastain ..she is also trying to gather her teammates to shake hands with the Australian team. .she herself providing spirited consolation to the Australian girls, simultaneously fighting off her own teammates who trying to lift her on their shoulders and somehow getting them to lift the coach instead..we additionally see her lifting Sally--a tearful moment for each.

dialogues.speaker: ON LISA
dialogues.text: Strangely turned shy by the feelings evoked. Enough.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Enough. . On the video, the stars and stripes are raised. .She successfully fights off emotion but comment is required.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Whew. As Lisa prepares to leave the room.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Did coach call you here?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Nope. Just thought I should speak to him while it could still maybe do some good. 1s INT. ATHLETIC DEPT. HALLWAY/COACH'S OFFICE - DAY 15 Sally follows her into the hallway.  16 WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 10.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Wow...The roster’s never been this late..but no..you can’t be on any bubble. .

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I was in the top box of his triangle of success chart in 17 of the 19 categories.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Well, oh my God then, so why? You think ‘cause Cam is on the college team here he could go with her? No. she’s not there yet..dust honestly.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: It's just the last couple of days an alarm'’s gone off and it feels more like..truth than nervous crap.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Well, hell -- go in. Find out for sure you're okay and we'll grab a beer. Lisa nods...and walks toward the office. The nameplate ne to the door reads “WILLIAM SMITH Head Coach.” Sally can’t resist getting in her ear to render last minute coaching she sees Lisa tense.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: (sotto) Confident, confident, relaxed, confident.. You are the best. Sally peals off and Lisa pauses a beat. It’s game face ti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She enters the coach’s office overplaying her sense of security and confidence by a mile or so.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Hey, coach. How's it going? WILLIAM SMITH is a good looking guy who excels at pushing manipulating others. He is surprised to see Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: COACH SMITH
dialogues.text: Hey, you. What‘s doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 17 18 WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 11.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: You have a minute?

dialogues.speaker: COACH SMITH
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I've been following the training guide you sent but doing two a days and I have shaved my time where you wanted by point 8.

dialogues.speaker: COACH SMITH
dialogues.text: Really good...but two a days can create different kinds of problems.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Okay, 1/11 stop. Good seeing you. Thanks for the time.

dialogues.speaker: COACH SMITH
dialogues.text: sure. She exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she sits in a full plane returning to Washington D.C...opens an old play book -- she is ‘acting” as if she were untroubled even though no one is watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liga working out with several girls from the national team. .She is fielding hot fungoes in a circle with teammates..little grunts..small off-camera utterances, as they encourage each other..Lisa’s phone starts to ring -- hears the distinctive music, turns, and, not seeing the b coming at her, takes one hard on the face. She has a bloo lip..The injury is close to an absolute non-event for her She spits some blood with enviable expertise as she walks her bag on the sidelines.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: It better be worth it. (she answers her phone) Hello. Intercut with:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 19 WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGE MADISON, in his mid 30’s. If anyone faults him as colorless it is because they have never paused on a foggy morning to consider the vibrancy of grey.. He is solid: solidly educated, solid in thought and deed and carry through. And, of course, so many mentions of the word “so portends that he will soon break apart from the intensity some serial migfortunes which will make it forever imposs (as a character will soon remark) to ever again be the pe he is at this moment.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Hi. (checks a piece of paper) Liga... This is George Madison. Did Riva tell you that she gave me your number?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: She said it might be a good idea for us to have dinner together.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Oh..well, let me call her...when did you have in mind?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: No. I wasn’t calling to set a time. She didn’t know I was seeing someone -- well, she didn't know that it had escalated a bit, at least on my part -- it just added up for me suddenly and... (catching himself at giving too much information) Well, anyway... Lisa seizes on the fun of his oddness..she grins, blood f the hit on her lip covering her front teeth.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: ...80 you're calling me to break up. Her teammates gather around on hearing this -- she grins bloody grin and gestures that the call is off the charts goofy. So much so she is enjoying herself.  WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 13.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I just didn’t think... A woman enters his office with George’s secretary, ANNIE, few steps behind trying to stop her. .they are briefly ou focus, as we remain concentrated on the phone call as Geo attempts to do the same.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: George Madison? He nods - but indicates he has a call to complete. Annie gives a short hand whispered message.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: She just..the rudeness. . George nods, pats the distraught Annie on the back.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (into phone) I’m sorry..I got distracted. What was I saying?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: “You just didn't think..”

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Right..thank you. (to Annie) Thank you. The woman ig surprised, unaccustomed to being thanked.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (ironically) You're welcome. She exits.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (into phone) Thank you for holding..I just didn’t think it was right not to phone you once I took your number in case she had talked to you and you were expecting my call.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Okay, then...It was nice of you to call in a way I guess.  20 WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 14.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Right. Sorry for interrupting your day.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Goodbye. He hangs up and mutters to himself..unconscious to the fa that he is doing so..

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: CouldIhavesoundedstranger? He looks down at the folder for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a class breaks the students. . (grad students) flow out...signs, blackboard, etc. indicate that it is a PHYSI CLASSROOM... .George is off to the side sending a text message...We read it.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE'S TEXT MESSAGE
dialogues.text: Dad? It’s important that we talk. I need some guidance and maybe Ron should be folded in as well. 1'11 be in early - Okay - be well. He finishes and looks off into space and shudders suddenl and unexpectedly. .registers surprise. It’s a first. He h never shuddered before. Now the Physics professor comes i view. This is TERRY DREISER, she is in the argument for t smartest woman alive - a physicist whose mind holds the promise of one day explaining it all to us. She is surpri to see him..

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: George, am I wrong, didn’t I tell you I'm crashing on the book tonight? She holds up the portable data plug which contains all he work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 21 WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 1s.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yeah, you did..I just..I’m not going to stay around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they enter --- her work is all laid out for her.. A waiting work cocoon of perfect reading light. .books..two computers and many, many stacks of research..She must mov sideways to get into the cramped work area where she puts HER DATA PLUG into its computer port and the screen comes alive with physics. .words and computations.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Maybe that’s better for tonight. I don’t know why I agreed to this delivery date..damn me and my need for approval. .Sorry. She slides into the cocoon -- no small feat.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Sure. It was nice seeing your face for a minute. Settles me down.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Anyway, I think I know what it is that's bothering you.. George is puzzled by this.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (crossing to him.) If you're concerned about us now that we've intensified..we're okay. I am busy so I can’t demonstrate to you that we’re okay in all the little ways like paying attention to you..but if you could just take my word for it until the work lets up that would really help me... and us. (beguiling) I think I like that word better. Us.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Thanks. Kiss.  22 23 WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 16. She slides out with some difficulty. .He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Hot kiss. He hot kisses her. She moans, pulls him closer with a lon leg..Terry has the ability to get instantly hot... and wh her very plump brain cells get that blood flow, insights result.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (hot and free) Don't let me get away with too much - that will never work for me ~ don't be too low maintenance that’s a ticking bomb.. but thanks for understanding this one. George is getting aroused... but not for long. She breaks off.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: See. We're good. He nods and exits as she turns back to her work, then tur realizing a beat late that her turn-on and sudden turn-of was sort of funny/strange..she flashes a good guy smile a shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As George walks off -- he moves past an outdoor job fair where dozens of corporations are interviewing soon to be MBA’s potential employees..an assembly line where the big start to package the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A foot race in progress...Lisa pounding the composite sur alongside a girl, RIVA, maybe eight years younger. Lisa, while running remembers something suddenly. .

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (gasping) Gotta talk to you after.

dialogues.speaker: RIVA
dialogues.text: (gasping less) I'll wait for you at the finish.  24 WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 17.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Sense of humor. She turns it on and it is fiercely competitive -- “full o as few experience the term. Riva wins barely. CAMERA REMA LOOKING STRAIGHT UP THE TRACK as each of the women goes t different side of frame to heave. It is a common occurren

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two women have just ordered breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: So... You gave my number to a guy?

dialogues.speaker: RIVA
dialogues.text: Yeah. I hardly know him..he went to business school with my brother...

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: How come you gave him my number anyway?

dialogues.speaker: RIVA
dialogues.text: You don’t remember Wednesday night-- you said you had never dated a non- athlete and maybe you should try one. .

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I did?

dialogues.speaker: RIVA
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Don't listen to me when I'm drinking Guiness.

dialogues.speaker: RIVA
dialogues.text: It’s the only time you really say stuff.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (briefly worried) I hope that’s not true.  25 WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is seated at a gide chair.. Annie opens the door a is quickly shoved aside by George's father CHARLES, vibra with an energy which leaves no doubt he came up through s and RON, the company’s legal counsel, who seems to squirt Protestant genes as he walks with perfect posture.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Good morning, Dad...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: You said, bring the company lawyer.. George hands his father the subpoena. .Ron reads over Cha shoulder. They each react instantly -- simultaneously shaken...Charles doesn’t trust himself to speak..he hands paper to Ron and paces off.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (to Charles) They are apparently investigating us for possible misstatement of receivables to inflate earnings.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: What do you know about this?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Nothing. But I’m responsible.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: What are you being noble. .?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I'm telling you what all recent legislation says. If it’s true and I didn’t know, I should have.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: The goddamn government’ s become like this horrible, punishing Mommy -

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Could you ask your assistant to come in -- we’re going to have to respond immediately.  WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 19.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Annie...could you please come on in and bring your laptop? Annie enters and looks at George -- worried about him. .S has worked for him for some time. She adores him. Ron is clearly grave.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: All these items mentioned -- you must have checked whether we had actual receipt of funds before we talked to the analysts..

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: No..most of them came from Dad‘s office so I assumed... His father makes a strangled half-bark of a noise and Geo glances at him.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: You don’t assume or trust anyone. . not him..certainly not me..

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Good guidelines I'm afraid.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (continuing) ..with everyone working creatively on the new line I thought I'd wait until.. Another noise from Dad. Annie stands just behind him -- s is unable to conceal the concerns and emotions born of he ferocious loyalty to George.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Just a second, Dad... There’s an overall involved here. My approach is different than yours was, which I tried to make clear when I took over, And it’s to get finance and legal out of the way of the creative. Charles makes a disparaging noise then:

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: (about to take over) Okay, now...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (softly but firm) Let me finish, please.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: No. Drivel doesn’t get to finish. Drivel gets interrupted. George continues nonetheless. His earnestness is palpable and, given his audience, ill advised.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: So...shaping the corporate culture may not bring results as quickly on the income statement as just eliminating jobs and wacking expenses. But, with patience it will work and, when it does, you've puilt something.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: (shout ing) You are a fucking moron. (catching himself) Too rough..

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Much too rough.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Don’t use that language in front of Annie.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Okay. I caught myself. Now may I get back to the fucking, sorry Annie, the fucking, sorry again Annie...point! (to George) You talk “creativity” to me? You M.B.A./C.P.A. dialogues.text: Coach the rich twins..maybe hang out with George a little. I’m seeing him later. He sends off his reply.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: What?!?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: No worries. It’s always athletes for me. And, the team is training in town and..I dunno..I was thinking of dropping by. The only thing is... 100. But Matty is distracted as a tone signals a reply to his reply which makes him laugh a little so that, as he conti to read, he does not sense Lisa’s presence when she enter to see him enjoying the text..

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Matty? He immediately disengages the phone, his attitude very ca in the cookie jar.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: We need to talk for a second.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: I'll call you from the car.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Are we monogamous?

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: You're feeling this way because of the road trip. But we don‘t have the time to do this.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: How much time does it take to answer?

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: The answer is, yes, of course, essentially. (on her look) That’s the truth. And my rule because I love you, is to always tell you the truth.  WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 101.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: You love me?

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: I've told you that.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: No, you haven't.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: Well, I told the whole bullpen.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: What’s “essentially?”

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: I am not anything like the wild man I used to be. If it bothers you, I will attempt to cut out even the anonymous sex. . {before she can speak) BECAUSE..I think we may be heading for the biggest result that can happen to a dating couple.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus, you stinker.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: A guy is willing to go one thousand miles for you and you criticize him because he ‘ADMITTEDLY’ hasn’t covered the last yard yet. Lisa has had the wind knocked out of her. This goes deep..shivering legs, a flash of some prescient terror, t whole deal..She is briefly helpless to do anything but so of hold herself and take stock. She is stunned by her own sense of internal devastation.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Um. .Whew..does this feel like shit. Boy! So this is what everybody is always talking about. She takes a breath...her freshly oxygenated brain kicks i

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: You have to get the team bus. You don't miss the team bus no matter what. We'll talk. I'm moving out. But we’1l talk.  112 WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 102.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: Don’t break up with me.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Well, that’s the thing, I don’t know if what we have is even anything breakable.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: Where you gonna go?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Well, I'm in luck because my tenants hate my place - they’ve been trying to get out of the deal. (emphatically) Don’t miss your team bus! We'll talk this out when you get back. You can't miss a team bus!!!

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: Okay, I decided. I’m going to be monogamous while I’m away. You too? She nods -- it is the furthest thing from her mind.

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: (continued) This will be okay.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Go! He cups her face..her eyes glisten..He means what he says next but, still, he is also consciously playing his “A” g

dialogues.speaker: MATTY
dialogues.text: Why do women always look best just as they are shifting away from you? He gives her a light kiss.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Oh, stop it! Jesus. She shoves him toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is slumped in a cushy chair, virtually asleep....Charles is on the phone in the next room.  WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 103.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: (into phone) Well, I’m going to possibly go into all the ramifications with my son. Then I can meet with you and the other lawyers..Okay, then. He hangs up and enters. He nudges George.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Weird. Never felt this tired.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Take my advice. I think you should get away from me. Cut me off. I’ve just been trying to avoid an inevitable here. Have to give up on that. I tried to steer you to the right lawyer. Your guy was wrong. I could have paid your bills - used money to make the government lose heart in a minor matter. But, no, you picked a shmoe.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I just work better with facts. Just tell me.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: George, I worked for a boiler stock operation when I was 19. There was a violation and I got one year probation.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Why are you bringing that up now? Charles is reluctant to continue.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Because of that if they find me at all responsible for the current problems I would be a repeat offender and could get 25 years in jail...that’s why I didn’t come forward. They look at each other...that fact produces a genuine, though brief, transcendent moment. In a fleeting gesture George touches his father’s arm in sympathy.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Wow Dad, what are we going to do here?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Finally and at last not your problem. I need you to go because I am in some wrestling match with myself here. I can’t trust myself not to manipulate you - I don't know if I’m doing it now. (gives it some thought} I think I am.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Has it occurred to you, as a possibility, that you can just say what happened..without trying to control the outcome?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Honestly, no. George gestures that it is worth a shot.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: If you pled out the sentence would be three years with a chance of getting it down to less than two..

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: And you’d....

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Get off. Maybe. Probably. George feels a sudden thrust of energy. -

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: That's everything? Charles nods.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Okay. I think this was a good visit.  113 WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 105.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, TRAINING FACILITY
dialogues.text: A practice game has just finished. .the U.S.A. beating a college team...one of the U.S.A.'s beefier players (who w know as PARTICULARLY EMOTIONAL GIRL) hits a home run and the game. .some photographers shoves the home run hitter of the way to take pictures of Cam, who was on base at th time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A figure on a hill taking in the action.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Gnawing on her lip in anxiety. She is actually considerin leaving before anyone sees her.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THE ACTION
dialogues.text: As the teams lines up to shake hands..Riva hurries throug the line spots Lisa and dashes up the hill...at least hal her teammates join her...including the home run hitter.

dialogues.speaker: ON LISA
dialogues.text: Even as she shouts an admonishment...

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Did you even finish shaking hands with the other team? Coach’11 blame me. But, here come the hugs and oh, God she loves them -- Eve she experiences the rush of being with them, she is worki her ass off to appear light-hearted. She puts her face cl to the beefy girl.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Look at you..Little Miss Home Run to the Opposite Field.

dialogues.speaker: PARTICULARLY EMOTIONAL GIRL
dialogues.text: Insane that you were here for it. (to other teammate) She worked on opposite field power with me.  114 WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Riva and Lisa sit on the grass together, having a beer The vibe is clearly intimate. They look down on the well- playing field... RIVA. You're doing okay. Your making the adjustment. Give it time. Maybe grad school and odd jobs aren't the right thing. Anybody would want you as an assistant coach.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I have to wade? that one.

dialogues.speaker: RIVA
dialogues.text: Till what?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Till I won't envy my players.

dialogues.speaker: RIVA
dialogues.text: Holy shit, Lise.. This isn’t you.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I hope not. Don’t tell anyone I'm this bad, or did I show it? (genuinely alarmed) Does everybody see it.. Is it leaking out of me? And all of this whining I do serves nothing ...like my mother said to me when she was sick, “you can’t cry and fix something at the same time.” (dabs at her eyes) Now I'm going to feel sorry for myself for losing my mother. Just wallow, wallow, wallow. Riva moves closer to put her arm around Lisa, who immedia shifts away, waving it off, not feeling deserving of comforting. And then, instead, grabs her friends two hand an attempt to give instead of take.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (continued) Listen to me, Riva, ‘cause this is my gift to you for putting up with me tonight. Stay ‘till they tear you away, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 115 116 WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 107. LISA(cont 'd) Play your heart out and when that’s not enough..kiss ass, have sex with a booster, do whatever it takes to hang on..because after what we had...you have.. real life is a killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To see Lisa in a very underpopulated commuter train car. simply must find surcease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he sits at his computer trying to write a letter. It i warm night and his large window is open at his elbow. We in on his computer..but just as we begin to read he hits delete key sweeping away two paragraphs and leaving just, “Dear Dad." His phone rings. He mishits the phone as he answers.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Hello. Even though he has yet to engage the phone he vaguely hea Lisa. LISA‘S VOICE Hello? He hits the right phone key.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Hi. Puzzled now by having seemingly heard Lisa's distant voic without benefit of a phone connection. He leans out his window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa standing beneath his window..phone in hand. She is working real hard at being the casual, immediate, uncomplicated girl she was so recently. But in this time distress it is just faux real folk.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Good. You okay?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Sure am. Hope it‘s not too late to call. She turns around and looks up at the window..he leans awa from the window.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: No. What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just that we made indefinite plans to hang out and I was trying to nail them down..schedule my week.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Well, anytime, though soon would be advisable.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (snorting at the preposterous thought) I guess it’s too late for tonight.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: No. Not at all. I am waiting for a call from my friend if she has her baby tonight..but we can deal with that if it happens.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Okay. Well, what the heck. Let’s take a shot. I can be there in...less than a half hour.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: This time of night it could be faster.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Good. I hope so.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Okay. I'11 see you soon and we'll just hang out. I mean, do you feel like hanging out?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Okay, so we'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: 20 minutes later as she kills time. She glances at he:
117 i watch. 118 There igs a knock on the door.. .he opens it and Lisa ent

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I think I should go.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Because I’m nuts and I seem to be going around dumping this nutty person on every nice person T know. I was downstairs when I called you.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: And you weren't going to say anything?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I just didn’t want to...

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Embarrass me?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Some cousin of that.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: You look good. You look rested. But everyone looks rested to me. George, help me out.  WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 110. He stands poised to do anything.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: With?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I can’t stop griping. You're the one who said it. “Did you ever want to delete everything you said just as you finished saying it?” And I thought that was the strangest thing and lately I hear myself being so weak, and whiny and needy that I wish I could dele... George quite suddenly clamps a hand over her mouth..She i surprised..feels a little violated, in fact..the observan will note that she actually has made a fist.

dialogues.speaker: LISA'S EYES
dialogues.text: As they appear over George’s hand and she tries to make s of the situation.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I think the answer to what you’re talking about is to stop talking. Just deny a voice to the thing that is falling apart. No lip service. That's my advice. Which I think I got from you. Sorry to handle you and the situation like this but it was an impulse. I’m letting go now. (noticing the fist) Don't hit me. ON LISA‘S EYES As they reflect understanding and gratitude just before h releases her...She takes a breath..touches him lightly in gratitude and moves away to sit down. The phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: {into phone) Hey. Really...how much? How do you feel?...Yeah sure..now..can I bring a friend? See you soon. He hangs up.  119 WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 111.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (to Lisa) She had the baby. I’m going over. You want to come?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: No. I’d be in the way and.. (she stops herself/mock stronger) Sure. Okay. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As George and Lisa sit in Annie’s hospital room..Her pare are just leaving. Annie has a sleeping baby in her arms.. is trying to hostess the coming and going..

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Hey, boss..Look what I found. . {to Lisa) And you’ re?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (enormously pleased) Wow. Mom..Dad..that’s boss and..

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: George Madison.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Good to see you, George.. Lisa.. Annie has told us about you both. Lisa is mystified. As they turn to wave to Annie..

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Thanks guys and remember Dad there are lotsa of tv shows with single mom heroines.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I'm fine. It's fine. Everybody's healthy. That‘s it. (to Lisa) Yhat's it, right? Lisa is mystified.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. They exit.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: It’s killing him.. (to Lisa) Nice to meet you finally. Lisa is distracted by the size of the baby.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Gee whiz.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (proudly) 10 pounds 10. And I'm three days early.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: You exhausted?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Oh..I’m slap happy.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: World's luckiest baby.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (pointedly to Lisa) Leave it to boss to say the great thing. The phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello..You're here? Fourth floor. Oh well, then just ask for Double Didget’s room. That’s what we're all calling him for now. (sheepishly to her baby) Your dad is here. 112. George and Lisa smile and start to go. Lisa lingers for a second to peek at the baby..they turn and George turns to his father enter the room. This Chinatown moment is immed and visceral --- George speaks in the hushed tone of the broken.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: No. .NO.  WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 113. Lisa glances up. George is on the verge of a seizure as Charles is nudged out the room's doorway by a heavyset ma carrying flowers and an old model video camera..His name AL.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: {quickly transitioning to Al) Hi. Congratulations on the birth of your baby. Al leans forward and hugs Annie, kisses the baby on the h

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (to Charles) It was very nice for you to come by, Mr. Madison.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Just wanted to drop this off..Tell you not to worry about your job in any way.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Well, that’s oh-my-God great to hear. Charles, having scored his point, looks around.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: (to George) You okay?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Tops.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Thought you might be here. Would you like to talk - go over anything..Any new thoughts?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: No. Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: You're thinking things out.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Not at this precise moment. I’m on a break.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: There's a time factor that I can no longer shield you from. (noticing Lisa) You a relative of Annie’s?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I'm a friend of George. Lisa. Charles eyes her more closely and extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Good to meet you. Call me Charles.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: I spoke to George minutes after he met you for the first time. Lisa is mystified.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: No kidding.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Yes..So I was the first to know. Lisa is mystified.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Outstanding.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: I'm his father.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Oh. Good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: That's nice of you to say. Okay, all..I Love you, son. Goodnight everyone. Charles exits. George is still coming down from what he briefly thought.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (to George) Boss, when he walked in..You didn’t think?  WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 115. George concedes that he did with a look.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: You poor guy. Al and Lisa exchange greetings. Al is flushed with viscer pleasure. Annie looks over at him...eye contact that cont the d.n.a. of all that is good and produces huge grins.

dialogues.speaker: ON AL
dialogues.text: The moment of his life is upon him. He walks over to Geor and whispers as he hands him his video camera. Hey?! I'm SHORE). do something record it..Red button. (he sits on the bed facing the mother of his child) I got to say something..to you. For christ's sake to the two of you. I don’t want you to think the reason we aren’t married is because I think anyone else is anything. It’s because I am 47 and a failure.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: I’11 kill you - you talk like that. During this exchange Lisa feels she is somehow violating their privacy and is trying to make her getaway but she c get George’s attention. Nonetheless she decides to exit a walks to the door.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: I’1l get work I guess..but no seniority anymore or...but don’t get me sidetracked. The reason I didn’t talk marriage is I couldn’t stand to see you -- the princess of worry -- weighted down by me and my limited prospects. And now he has Lisa’s attention. She pauses at the door.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: Because I get your worry. And people could think that’s the bad thing about you but I get that it’s because of your great heart..and I love you for it.  WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 116. AL (cont'd) And then I worried about what would happen to you - and now the little hulk - if you ended up with someone who thought your worry was --

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Neurotic?

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: Yes. Someone who didn’t get you..who made you feel bad about yourself..who wanted you to be more normal..who wanted you to like yourself more. Who wanted you to change. Who didn’t love all of it. Who wouldn’t leave great enough alone. And, -- I didn’t sleep, man...I thought I can do that for you...and that was a legitimate function for me in your life. Annie cheers as if at a ballgame.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: And that allows me to propose to you that we get married. Annie blubbers. Al is emotional. Lisa is rapt. Al hugs Annie..Lisa and George applaud as Annie and Al have a bri and intimate exchange.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: You‘re not scared anymore.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: I am. But scared is a step up from terror and terror is what I feel about losing you. Annie gasps. Al holds her in this, their quintessential moment. Al looks at George and says through tear glazed e

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: Did you get it?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (stricken) Oh my God..I just got caught up with what you were saying. .

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: (this can’t have happened) You didn’t get it?  WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 117.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: No. Annie has missed this exchange due to being blissed out. Al He didn’t get it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (stricken) He didn’t get it????

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I can’t tell you how...

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (driving force) Come on..right away - let‘s do it again. Just do it now..go ahead, Al. We'll record it. Al is willing but there is a problem.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: Who knows what I said?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I. sure do..

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Let's just think and piece this together right away.. Everyone is wiping tears away as they agree to try. Al ge to his initial position when he said his piece. George, a deliberately as possible, pushes the record switch. What follows is very informal..some improvs called for; people talking on top of one another..this group exercise is mar by great spirit and enormous light heartedness. .but stil real dedication to the task at hand..recreating the propo

dialogues.speaker: ON AL
dialogues.text: As he takes his highly self-conscious shot.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: I didn't want you to think that the reason I didn't ask to get married was because I ever had a thought of anyone else... He’s stuck.  WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 118.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (to Al) You said it was because you had no prospects. You used the word “failure.”

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: (to Annie) It's because I don’t want to saddle you with a 47 year old failure. Lisa comes in quickly.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Annie..”I‘11 kill you if..”

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: {laughing) Thanks. “I’11 kill you if you talk like that.”

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Then you said that you didn’t want her to end up with ..

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Someone who wanted her to change what she couldn’t change.. Annie’s line grounds things. The laughter stops---the imp and dignity return -

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: (cont ‘ d) Someone who didn’t get me.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: There was that whole list.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (primarily to Annie) He was worried that you’d be with someone who made you feel bad about yourself...who wanted you to like yourself in a different way. Who wanted you to change. Who didn’t love all of you.  WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 119.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (primarily to Al} You said that protecting her from that - appreciating her the way you do..was a legitimate function for you in her life.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: Wow. I said that?

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: I feel like you're all proposing to me.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: And then I asked you to marry me.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: No, no, no! What you said was... (enunciating very carefully) *I propose to you that we get married.”

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: And you called him, “little hulk,” which, I don’t know why, is my favorite thing. I love you so much, Al. Thanks everybody. {to George) I think we have it. He stops recording. She holds her arms out and gives him hug.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: I'm so worried about you.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Please don’t.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: Let her be. George nods..claps Al on the back. Lisa approaches Annie has to laugh even as she says the nuclear understatement.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Well, it was nice meeting you. They hug. Annie laughs as well.  120 121 WHITE DRAFT 5/29/09 120.

dialogues.speaker: ANNIE
dialogues.text: Nice meeting you too. I love you. And that cracks them up because, like they say, “it’s fun because it’s true.”

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (helplessly) Me too. George is truly digging Lisa. And now the awkwardness as nod and exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The awful thing is the sharp change in their ethos. A sec ago they seemed a couple..and now, that quickly, much lik Double Digit so recently experienced, they are thrust fro that warm, safe, womb like space into the awkward starkne of the real world. There is considerable culture shock as they walk toward the exit of the hospital self-consciousl the space between them as they walk widening in small increments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
